sen.j: 高野山真言宗（こうやさんしんごんしゅう）は、平安時代初頭に弘法大師（空海）が入唐し、唐（中国）・長安（西安市）の青龍寺 (西安市)で恵果（けいか・えか）から密教を学び、日本に帰国後、開いた真言宗の一宗派。
sen.e: Koyasan Shingon sect is one of Shingon sect that was founded in the early Heian Period by Kobo Daishi (a posthumous title of the priest Kukai) who visited to China and studied Esoteric Buddhism with Keika (also called Eka) in Qinglongsi Temple (in Xian City) in Changan (Xian City) during the Tang Dynasty (China).

sen.j: 寺号の金剛峯寺の金剛峯の名称は「金剛峯楼閣一切瑜伽瑜祗経」（こんごうぶろうかくいっさいゆがゆぎきょう）の最初の3文字（金剛峯）を引用して、空海が名付けた。
sen.e: Kukai named Kongobu of Kongobu-ji Temple after three Kanji characters from 'Kongobu rokaku issai yuga yugakyo.'

sen.j: 平成18年（2006年）11月15日に高野山真言宗総本山金剛峯寺第412世座主に高野山補陀落院（ふだらくいん）住職の松長有慶大僧正が就任。
sen.e: Yukei MATSUNAGA, a Daisojo (a Buddhist priest of the highest order) and a chief priest of Fudaraku-in Temple of Koyasan, assumed the 412th head priest of Kongobu-ji Temple, Grand Head Temple of Koyasan Shingon sect in November 15, 2006.

sen.j: 1593年（文禄2年）に豊臣秀吉が母・大政所の追善菩提のために高野山に建立した青厳寺と1590年（天正18年）に木食応其が建立した興山寺を1869年（明治2年）に合併して、寺号を金剛峯寺とした。
sen.e: The temple name became Kongobu-ji Temple after the merger in 1869 between Seigan-ji Temple in Koyasan founded by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in 1593 for the memorial salvation of his mother, Omandokoro (Mother of the chief Adviser to the Emperor), and Kozan-ji Temple founded by Mokujiki Ogo in 1590.

The temple name became Kongobu-ji Temple after the merger in 1869 between Seigan-ji Temple in Koyasan founded by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in 1593 for the repose of the soul of his mother, Omandokoro (Mother of the chief Adviser to the Emperor), and Kozan-ji Temple founded by Mokujiki Ogo in 1590.

sen.j: 興山寺は後陽成天皇より「興山寺」の勅額が下賜され、勅願寺であった。
sen.e: A Kozan-ji Temple was a Chokugan-ji Temple (temple built at the order of the emperor) where the Imperial scroll of 'Kozan-ji Temple' was granted it as an Imperial gift from Emperor Goyozei.

sen.e: Before the merger, the temple name of Kongobu-ji Temple was the name for the entire Koyasan (Mt. Koya).

sen.j: 明治以降、政府の宗教政策から、他の真言宗宗派（真言宗御室派（総本山仁和寺）・真言宗大覚寺派（大本山大覚寺）など）と合同した古義真言宗に属し、古義真言宗総本山となる。
sen.e: After Meiji period, with the religious policies of the government, the Koyasan Shingon sect belonged to the Old Shingon sect which was merged with the other religious schools of Shingon sect (Omuro school of Shingon sect [the grand head temple is Ninna-ji Temple], Daikaku-ji school of Shingon sect [the head temple is Daikaku-ji Temple] etc.), and became the grand head temple of Old Shingon sect.

After the Meiji period, in accordance with the religious policies of the government, the Koyasan Shingon sect became a part of the Old Shingon sect, which was merged with the other religious schools of the Shingon sect (Omuro school of the Shingon sect [the grand head temple is Ninna-ji Temple], Daikaku-ji school of the Shingon sect [the head temple is Daikaku-ji Temple], etc.), and became the grand head temple of the Old Shingon sect.

sen.j: のちに分派・合同した。

sen.j: 教学（教義）から区分すれば、大日如来の本地説法身を説く高野山の教学（古義）を持つ古義真言宗諸派（真言宗御室派・真言宗大覚寺派など）の古義真言宗（古義派）に属して基幹をなす。
sen.e: When classifying the Koyasan Shingon sect according to the creed, the religious doctrines were based on the Old Shingon sect (Old-interpretation school) of Old Shingon schools (Omuro school of Shingon Sect or Daikaku-ji school of Shingon sect etc.) which had ancient principles of Koyasan that preached Honjishin (dharma-body) preaching of Dainichi Nyorai (Mahavairocana).
sen.cmt: 教学（教義）,教学（古義）はカッコ内の意味と文脈を考え、それぞれに適切な言葉で訳しているため、原文どおり（）をつけた訳にはなっていません。本地説法身→誤植？「本地身説法」と理解し訳しています。
sen.e: When classifying the Koyasan Shingon sect according to the creed, it belongs to the Old Shingon sect (Old-interpretation school) of Old Shingon schools (Omuro school of Shingon Sect or Daikaku-ji school of Shingon sect etc.) which have ancient principles of Koyasan that preach the theory of Honjishin (dharma-body of Dainichi Nyorai (Mahavairocana), ant it makes the base of the sect.
sen.cmt: 過去形を現在形に改めました。 「基幹をなす」にあたる部分がなかったので補って訳しました。

sen.j: 対して、13世紀末に古義真言宗から別れ、覚鑁（かくばん）（興教大師）を派祖とする。
sen.e: On the other hand, the Koyasan Shingon sect was split from the Old Shingon sect in the end of thirteenth century and it had Kakuban (Kogyo Daishi) as a founder of school.
On the other hand, New Shingon sect (New-interpretation school) was branched from the Old Shingon sect at the end of 13th century and founded by Kakuban (Kogyo Daishi).
sen.cmt: 文脈から判断すると、次のセルと合わせて1文として処理されるべきと思われますが、2文として処理され、意味も誤って理解されているようなので、新たに2文として訳し直しています。
sen.e: On the other hand, New Shingon sect (New-interpretation school) was branched from the Old Shingon sect at the end of 13th century and founded by Kakuban (Kogyo Daishi).

sen.j: 大日如来の加持身説の教学（新義）を持った新義真言宗（新義派）があり、根来寺（新義真言宗総本山）（和歌山県）から分流した新義真言宗諸派（真言宗智山派・真言宗豊山派など）がある。
sen.e: It had New Shingon sect (New-interpretation school) which had new principles that preached Kajishin (Buddha-body within a practitioner [esoteric Buddhism]) preaching of Dainichi Nyorai and there are New Shingon schools (Chizan school of Shingon sect, or Buzan school of Shingo sect etc.) split from Negoro-ji Temple (Grand Head Temple of New Shingon sect in Wakayama Prefecture).

The New Shingon sect has new principles that preach the doctrine based on Kajishin (Buddha-body within a practitioner [esoteric Buddhism]) and includes New Shingon schools (Chizan School of Shingon Sect, Buzan School of Shingon sect, etc.) branched from Negoro-ji Temple (Grand Head Temple of New Shingon sect)(Wakayama Prefecture).

The New Shingon sect has new principles that preach the doctrine based on Kajishin (Buddha-body within a practitioner [esoteric Buddhism]) and includes New Shingon schools (Chizan School of Shingon Sect, Buzan School of Shingon sect, etc.) branched from Negoro-ji Temple (Grand Head Temple of New Shingon sect)(Wakayama Prefecture).

sen.j: 高野山奥の院・弘法大師御廟を信仰の源泉とする。
sen.e: Oku no in (inner temple), the mausoleum of Kobo Daishi in Koyasan is the origin of the religious belief.

sen.j: 信仰の対象としては、西塔・根本大塔には両部（金剛界・胎蔵界）大日如来を祀り、御影堂（みえどう）（弘法大師御住坊・現在は、真如様（しんにょよう）の弘法大師御影（絵像）を祀る）・不動堂などの伽藍・諸堂がある壇上があり、弘法大師入定の地・奥の院御廟は聖地。
sen.e: For the objects for worship, Dainichi Nyorai of both Kongokai (spiritual principles) and Taizokai (physical principles) are worshiped in Saito (literally, Western Tower) and Konpon Daito (literally, Primal Tower), and there are Garan and halls such as Goeido Hall (to worship) or Fudodo Hall and the Oku no in, the mausoleum, is the sacred place for the Nyujo (calm contemplation) of Kobo Daishi.
sen.cmt: 両部（金剛界・胎蔵界）→()内を利用して訳出しています。
sen.e: As the objects for worship, Dainichi Nyorai of both Kongokai (spiritual principles) and Taizokai (physical principles) are enshrined in Saito (literally, Western Tower) and Konpon Daito (literally, Primal Tower), and there is a danjo (platform for religious practice) on which Garan and halls such as Miedo Hall (It was a dwelling of Kobo Daishito and now enshrines Mie (image) of Kobo Daishi) and Fudodo Hall are built, and the mausoleum of Kobo Daishi in Okunoin, where he attained Nirvana, is the sacred place.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ：「壇上」にあたる部分がありませんので、その意味から訳を考えました。全体的に訳を改めました。 「御影」の読みは原文に倣いました。
sen.e: As the objects for worship, Dainichi Nyorai of both Kongokai (spiritual principles) and Taizokai (physical principles) are enshrined in Saito (literally, Western Tower) and Konpon Daito (literally, Primal Tower), and there is a danjo (platform for religious practice) on which Garan and halls such as Miedo Hall (It was a dwelling of Kobo Daishito and now enshrines Mie (image) of Kobo Daishi) and Fudodo Hall are built, and the mausoleum of Kobo Daishi in Okunoin, where he attained Nirvana, is the sacred place.

sen.j: 宇宙すべてのものは大日如来の「いのち」の顕れであり、この「いのち」を表現したのが「曼荼羅」である。
sen.e: All the things in the universe are representations of 'Life' of Dainichi Nyorai and 'Mandala' represents the 'Life.'
All the things in the universe are representations of 'Life' of Dainichi Nyorai and 'Mandala' represents the 'Life.'

sen.j: 根本仏を法身仏の大日如来、根本経典を「大日経」「金剛頂経」とする。
sen.e: The primal Buddhist image is Dainichi Nyorai of the Dharmakaya Buddha and the primal scriptures are 'Dainichi-kyo (Mahavairocana Sutra)' and 'Kongocho-kyo (Vajrasekhara Sutra).'
The primal Buddhist image is Dainichi Nyorai of the Dharmakaya Buddha and the primal scriptures are 'Dainichi-kyo (Mahavairocana Sutra)' and 'Kongocho-kyo (Vajrasekhara Sutra).'

sen.j: 1984年（昭和59年）に菩提心の復活と即身成仏の教え（「いのち」の平等と尊厳をさとり、大日如来の智慧をこの世に実現する）を広め、この世に生きた仏国土をつくり、心豊かな社会の実現を目指して、テーマとし、標語「生かせ いのち」を提唱した。
sen.e: In 1984, the Koyasan Shinto sect aimed at realizing a spiritually rich society by spreading the revival of aspiration for Buddhahood and the message of Sokushin-Jobutsu (to learn the equality and dignity of 'Life' and realize the wisdom of Dainichi Nyorai in this world), and creating the living Buddha Lands in this world, and it advocated the slogan 'Live Life.'
sen.cmt: 「生かせ いのち」定訳不明です。
sen.e: In 1984, the Koyasan Shinto sect advocated the slogan 'Make the Most of Life', aiming at realizing a spiritually rich society by spreading the revival of aspiration for Buddhahood and the message of Sokushin-Jobutsu (to learn the equality and dignity of 'Life' and realize the wisdom of Dainichi Nyorai in this world), and creating the living Buddha Lands in this world.
sen.cmt: 「提唱した」の部分を前に持ってきました。
sen.e: In 1984, the Koyasan Shinto sect advocated the slogan 'Make the Most of Life', aiming at realizing a spiritually rich society by spreading the revival of aspiration for Buddhahood and the message of Sokushin-Jobutsu (to learn the equality and dignity of 'Life' and realize the wisdom of Dainichi Nyorai in this world), and creating the living Buddha Lands in this world.

sen.j: また、弘法大師の共利衆生（きょうりしゅじょう）の精神に立ち、社会に貢献する「御宝号念誦運動」を宗団として取り組んでいる。
sen.e: With the spirit of Kyori Shoju (the idea that all living things can receive a benefit, that is, live oneself and others together) by Kobo Daishi, they are working as 'Gohogo Nenju (recite a prayer to the Amitabuddah) Movement' a religious group to contribute to society.
sen.cmt: 共利衆生→定訳不明です。「御宝号念誦運動」定訳不明です。
sen.e: With the spirit of Kyori Shoju (the idea that all living things can receive a benefit, that is, live oneself and others together) by Kobo Daishi, they are working as 'Gohogo Nenju (recite a prayer to the Amitabuddah) Movement' a religious group to contribute to society.

sen.e: The 'Gohogo' means 'Namu Daishi Henjo Kongo (a sutra which is chanted to worship Kobo Daishi).'

sen.e: No.1 to 5 are the requirements for chief priest, and in addition, Horyu Sojo (inheritance of the system of teachings) is required.

sen.j: 住職以外に、副住職を置く寺院がある。
sen.e: There are some temples which have a vice priest other than the chief priest.
There are some temples which have a vice priest other than the chief priest.
There are some temples which have a vice priest other than the chief priest.

sen.j: 高野山真言宗の寺院住職に補任されて、20年を経るなど、高野山真言宗の定める要件を満たすと、名誉住職（めいよじゅうしょく）の称号が許される。
sen.e: When the priest is appointed to the chief priest of the temple in Koyasan Shingon sect, and when he fulfills the requirements set by the Koyasan Shingon sect such as serving out as the chief priest for 20 years, then he would be admitted the title of a honorary chief priest.

when he fulfills the requirements set by the Koyasan Shingon sect such as serving out as the chief priest of a temple belonging to Koyasan Shingon sect for 20 years, he would be admitted the title of a honorary chief priest.
sen.cmt: 最初の文を削除して、後の文を少し補いました。
sen.e: when he fulfills the requirements set by the Koyasan Shingon sect such as serving out as the chief priest of a temple belonging to Koyasan Shingon sect for 20 years, he would be admitted the title of a honorary chief priest.

sen.j: 高野山真言宗では住職には任期がなく、終身制を採っていたが、高齢などの理由で住職を辞した場合、辞した住職は、厳密にいうと身分上、その住職が務めていた寺院の徒弟となる。
sen.e: Koyasan Shingon sect did not have the term of the chief priest, and it had a lifetime system, and then when the chief priest left his service due to old age or other reasons, he would be an apprentice in the temple where he used to serve as the chief priest.
sen.cmt: 訳文の中で身分について訳出しているので、敢えて「厳密にいうと身分上、」の部分は訳出していません。
sen.e: Koyasan Shingon sect did not have the term of the chief priest, and it had a lifetime system, but when the chief priest leave his service due to old age or other reasons, he would be an apprentice in the temple where he used to serve.
sen.cmt: "and then"⇒butとしました。文末の表現も冗長なので削除しました。
sen.e: Koyasan Shingon sect did not have the term of the chief priest, and it had a lifetime system, but when the chief priest leave his service due to old age or other reasons, he would be an apprentice in the temple where he used to serve.

sen.j: 他の徒弟と同じ身分となる。
sen.e: The chief priest will be the same status with other apprentices.
The chief priest will be in the same status as other apprentices.
sen.cmt: 「身分」＝in the status としました。
sen.e: The chief priest will be in the same status as other apprentices.

sen.j: これは、住職を辞して後も引き続き寺院に居住して、後継の住職に対して指導・教育に当たるとき、身分上と言えども、寺院の徒弟（前住職）が住職に指導するということになってしまう。
sen.e: When the chief priest continues to live in the temple to educate a successive one after the retirement from the chief priest, even in the terms of the status, the apprentice (previous chief priest) in the temple would teach a chief priest.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: When the chief priest continues to live in the temple to educate a successive one after the retirement from the chief priest, even in the terms of the status, the apprentice (previous chief priest) in the temple would teach a chief priest.

When the chief priest continues to live in the temple to educate a successive one after the retirement from the chief priest, even in the terms of the status, the apprentice (previous chief priest) in the temple would teach a chief priest.

sen.j: そのため住職を辞しても身分を保障する配慮として、名誉住職という地位を設けた。
sen.e: Therefore, the title of a honorary chief priest was established in consideration of the guarantee of status.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処原文に「そのため」とつけ加え、自然な文章の流れになるようにしました。
sen.e: Therefore, the title of a honorary chief priest was established in consideration of the guarantee of status after the retirement from the chief priest.
sen.cmt: 「住職を辞しても」にあたる部分を加えました。
sen.e: Therefore, the title of a honorary chief priest was established in consideration of the guarantee of status after the retirement from the chief priest.

sen.j: また、名誉住職を設けることで、住職の交代を容易にして人事を活発化させる目的もある。
sen.e: Establishing the honorary chief priest can rotate the position of chief priest easier and activate personal affairs.
Another purpose of establishing the honorary post is to activate personnel by making it easy to replace the chief priest.
sen.cmt: 全体的に原文の意に沿うよう訳し直しました。
sen.e: Another purpose of establishing the honorary post is to activate personnel by making it easy to replace the chief priest.

sen.j: 住職と名誉住職の、寺院内での職務上の権利の差異はほとんどないが、名誉住職に関しては、高野山真言宗管長の被選挙権がなく、制限が設けられている。
sen.e: There is little difference between the chief priest and the honorary chief priest in their official authorities in the temple, although the honorary chief priest does not have eligibility to run for the chief abbot of Koyasan Shingon sect.
